intro: Echium gaditanum, commonly known as the Spanish thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, while its stems are erect and often branched. Echium gaditanum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms.
